Row.Text: Our people are playing your valiha and dancing with corpses of our ancestors. I fear the whole world will succumb to the influences of your culture.

The traditional folktale, Ibonia, has been told across the island of Madagascar for at least several hundred years. In order to strengthen our culture and traditions, we should have the Ibonia transcripted and distributed to the world. [NEWLINE]Requirement/Restrictions: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Player must be Imerina [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Must have free [ICON_GREAT_WORK] Great Work of Writing slot [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]May only be enacted once per game [NEWLINE]Costs: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]{1_Culture} [ICON_CULTURE] Culture [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]1 [ICON_MAGISTRATES] Magistrates [NEWLINE]Rewards: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Receive a unique Great Work of Writing [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Receive [ICON_CULTURE] Culture and [ICON_PEACE] Faith whenever a [ICON_WRITER] Great Writer is expended for each Rova within your Empire

The traditional folktale, Ibonia, has been told across the island of Madagascar for at least several hundred years. In order to strengthen our culture and traditions, we should have the Ibonia transcripted and distributed to the world. [NEWLINE]Rewards: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Receive a unique Great Work of Writing [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Receive [ICON_CULTURE] Culture and [ICON_PEACE] Faith whenever a [ICON_WRITER] Great Writer is expended for each Rova within your Empire

“The Prince of the East, they say,[NEWLINE] was stirred to pay a visit to Skyfather.[NEWLINE] He took his children with him:[NEWLINE] Gray-Eyed Man, Young-Man-Worth-Six, Princess Like-a-Man,[NEWLINE] and his subjects, Many Cares and Many Close Ones.[NEWLINE] He took ten bulls and ten cows with their young,[NEWLINE] from the Kingdom of Many and the Valley of Many Trees.”

Our Empire is grand and filled with wonders. However, we lack a home worthy of our sovereigns. We should construct in the capital the Rovan’i Manjakamiadana, Rova of Antananarivo; the greatest royal palace complex ever raised! [NEWLINE]Requirement/Restrictions: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Player must be Imerina [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]May be enacted after reaching the Renaissance Era [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Must have at least three Rova Improvements [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]May only be enacted once per game [NEWLINE]Costs: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]{1_Gold} [ICON_GOLD] Gold [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]2 [ICON_MAGISTRATES] Magistrates [NEWLINE]Rewards: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Rovas yield an additional +2 [ICON_PEACE] Faith and +1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]+3% [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production towards Military Units in the Capital for each Rova within your Empire (max. 30%)

Our Empire is grand and filled with wonders. However, we lack a home worthy of our sovereigns. We should construct in the capital the Rovan’i Manjakamiadana, Rova of Antananarivo; the greatest royal palace complex ever raised!
